titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Nicholas Jones and Gabriel Nall, Indictment
CWG7508

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
No 1
State of Kentucky
Union Circuit Court
October Term 1865
The Commonwealth fo Kentucky
against
Nicholas Jones & Gabriel Nolls

The Grand Jury of Union County in the name, and by the authority of, the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Nicholas Jones and Gabriel Nolls of the crime of murder, Committed as follows, viz: The said Nicholas Jones and Gabriel Nolls on the 1st day of August 1865 in the County aforesaid did feloniously and with malice aforethought kill and murder Samuel Dial by shooting him with a Pistol, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

John Barrett
Commonwealth's Attorney
14th Judicial District

Information by
Margaret Dial
Lidia Montgomery
Alphin Bailie

"A. true bill.
Hugh McElroy
Foreman Grand Jury"
No bail is allowed on this Indictment,

W, P, Fowler Judge
1865 Oct. 5th. Filed in open Court,"

I, D. C. James Clerk of the Union Circuit Court, State of Kentucky do certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the Indictment and the endorsments entered thereon, in the case that it purports to be as the same appears to me in my Office
Give under my hand this 1st day of January 1866
D. C. James C, U, C, C,

Comth of Ky
vs } Copy Indictment
Jones & Noll
